IP2025035_syn_1:
Indication: LUL nodule (20mm).
Proc: Ion Robotic, Radial EBUS, Cone-Beam CT, Cryo.
Details: Nav to LUL apicoposterior. REBUS concentric. CBCT confirmed. Cryo x3, Forceps x3.
ROSE: Adenocarcinoma.
Comp: Mild bleed, wedged.
Disp: Home.
IP2025035_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Robotic-Assisted Bronchoscopy with Cone-Beam CT and Cryobiopsy.
INDICATION: Solitary LUL pulmonary nodule.
NARRATIVE: The Ion robotic catheter was registered and navigated to the target in the apicoposterior segment of the LUL. Localization was multimodal: radial EBUS (concentric) and Cone-Beam CT (tool-in-lesion). Transbronchial cryobiopsies and standard forceps biopsies were obtained. ROSE confirmed adenocarcinoma. 
IMPRESSION: Primary Lung Adenocarcinoma.
IP2025035_syn_3:
Codes: 31628 (Biopsy), 31627 (Robotic Nav), 31654 (REBUS).
Note: Cryobiopsy used for tissue acquisition (billed as biopsy).
Imaging: Cone-beam CT and Radial EBUS used for verification.
IP2025035_syn_4:
Procedure: Ion + Cryo
Patient: [REDACTED]
Steps:
1. GA. Ion registered.
2. Navigated to LUL nodule.
3. Checked with REBUS and Spin CT.
4. Cryoprobe used for 3 biopsies.
5. Forceps used for 3 biopsies.
6. ROSE: Adeno.
7. Mild bleeding, stopped.
Result: Cancer.
IP2025035_syn_5: [REDACTED] 59 female LUL nodule. Used the Ion robot. Navigated out there confirmed with radial ebus and the cone beam spin. Took 3 cryo biopsies and 3 forceps. ROSE says adenocarcinoma. a little bleeding but wedging stopped it. discharged to home.
IP2025035_syn_6: Robotic Bronchoscopy / EBUS Note. Procedures: Ion robotic-assisted bronchoscopy, Radial EBUS and cone-beam CT, Transbronchial cryobiopsy and forceps biopsy of LUL nodule. Patient: Olivia Carter. Robotic catheter navigated to apicoposterior segment of LUL. Concentric radial EBUS view obtained. Cone-beam CT confirmed tool-in-lesion. Three cryobiopsies and three standard forceps biopsies performed. ROSE: Malignant epithelial cells, favor adenocarcinoma.
IP2025035_syn_7:
[Indication]
LUL Nodule (20mm).
[Anesthesia]
General.
[Description]
Ion Robotic Navigation. Radial EBUS concentric. Cone-Beam CT confirmation. Cryobiopsy x3, Forceps x3. Diagnosis: Adenocarcinoma.
[Plan]
Lung cancer clinic.
IP2025035_syn_8: [REDACTED] a robotic bronchoscopy for her left lung nodule. We drove the robotic catheter to the exact spot and used both ultrasound and a 3D CT spin in the room to make sure we were right inside the nodule. We used a freezing probe (cryobiopsy) to get large samples. The preliminary results show adenocarcinoma. She went home after waking up.
IP2025035_syn_9:
Procedure: Robotic navigational parenchymal sampling.
Tools: Ion platform, cryoprobe, Cone-Beam CT.
Action: The LUL target was localized via shape-sensing robotics and confirmed radiographically. Cryo-adhesion and forceps extraction yielded diagnostic tissue.
Result: Adenocarcinoma.
IP2025035:
Robotic Bronchoscopy / EBUS Note
Procedures:
1. Ion robotic-assisted bronchoscopy
2. Radial EBUS and cone-beam CT
3. Transbronchial cryobiopsy and forceps biopsy of LUL nodule
Patient: [REDACTED], 59-year-old female with 20 mm left upper lobe nodule and normal mediastinal imaging.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.0 ETT; pressure control ventilation.
Details: Robotic catheter navigated to apicoposterior segment of LUL using CT-to-body registration (error 2.1 mm). Concentric radial EBUS view obtained. Cone-beam CT confirmed tool-in-lesion. Three cryobiopsies (1.1 mm cryoprobe) and three standard forceps biopsies performed.
ROSE from cryobiopsy: Malignant epithelial cells, favor adenocarcinoma.
Complications: Mild bleeding, controlled with wedging. No pneumothorax on immediate cone-beam CT.
Disposition: Extubated and discharged from PACU after uneventful recovery.
